pull_request.title: Fix macros so AES version compilation actually works
pull_request.body: While working on something else, I noticed that the options from configure to select the different AES configurations weren't actually getting used, so it was always using the plain C AES implementation even when we directed it to use the AES_NI or OpenSSL AES implementations.  This patch fixes that.

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for quantum-resistant cryptographic algorithms.

repo.description: C library for quantum-resistant cryptographic algorithms.

pull_request.title: Update PQClean implementations to have AES key schedule release
pull_request.body:
liboqs has several AES implementations available to it, one of which (OpenSSL EVP) requires that the key schedule be allocated on the heap and release after use.  In particular it cannot be done on the stack (https://github.com/openssl/openssl/issues/962#issuecomment-208792020).  This patch adds a release function for the AES key schedule in the PQClean shims.

Depends on #496.

pull_request.title: Add Dilithium as auth method in TLS 1.3
pull_request.body:
This PR adds the dilithium (2,3, and 4) as auth method in TLS 1.3.

Not ready to merge: 
Currently, the branch compiles, generates self-signed root CA certificates for dilithium, and generates the server key pair and certificate request to CA.

But, gives this error when the CA attempts to generate the signed server certificate:
> Signature verification error
140361263314752:error:0D0C50C7:asn1 encoding routines:ASN1_item_verify:unknown signature algorithm:crypto/asn1/a_verify.c:115:

Also, I was not able to automatically generate the object files with the command `make generate_crypto_objects`  and filled the related filled manually (it might be related).

pull_request.title: Fixed regression due to PQClean round 2 NewHope
pull_request.body: This PR addresses the regression introduced by this commit: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/commit/16ea923cec860f1ba71235756302b21886c1d189, and also adds a Circle CI workflow that should run all the jobs every night.
